channel.title: CyberNetSec - Ransomware
channel.description: Latest ransomware threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: New 'Osiris' Ransomware Borrows TTPs from Medusa and Inc Gangs, Uses Signed Driver to Kill AV
item.description:
A new ransomware strain named Osiris is demonstrating a high level of sophistication by combining tactics from established ransomware groups like Medusa and Inc. The attackers use Rclone for data exfiltration to Wasabi cloud storage and deploy a version of Mimikatz named `kaz.exe`, both TTPs linked ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: INC Ransomware OPSEC Fail: Reused Infrastructure Leads to Data Recovery for 12 U.S. Victims
item.description:
A significant operational security (OPSEC) failure by the INC ransomware group has allowed cybersecurity firm Cyber Centaurs to recover stolen data for twelve U.S. organizations. The discovery was made after analyzing an attack involving the RainINC ransomware variant. Researchers found artifacts fr...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Incident Response, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Anubis RaaS Ups the Ante with Destructive 'Wipe Mode' to Maximize Extortion
item.description:
A new Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation named Anubis is gaining attention for its destructive capabilities. Evolving from a prototype called 'Sphinx,' Anubis offers its affiliates a dual-execution model. In addition to standard encryption, the malware can be run with a `/WIPEMODE` parameter t...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Leaks Data of 72 Million Under Armour Customers After Failed Talks
item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed a massive data breach against athletic apparel giant Under Armour. After negotiations allegedly failed, the group announced on its dark web leak site that it has published the full dataset, which it claims contains 191 million records, including 72.7 million ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Claims 861GB Data Breach at McDonald's India
item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed a major cyberattack against McDonald's India, alleging the theft of 861 gigabytes of sensitive data. In a post on its dark web leak site on January 20, 2026, the group threatened to publicly release the information if a ransom is not paid. The compromised dat...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: RansomHub Hits Apple Supplier Luxshare, Claims Theft of R&D Data for Apple, Nvidia, and Tesla
item.description:
The RansomHub ransomware group has claimed a significant data breach against Luxshare Precision Industry, a major Chinese electronics manufacturer and a critical partner for Apple, Nvidia, Tesla, and other tech giants. In a dark web post on January 21, 2026, the group alleged it had stolen and encry...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Ingram Micro Breach Exposes Data of 42,000 After Safepay Ransomware Attack
item.description:
Global IT distributor Ingram Micro has officially notified 42,521 individuals that their personal and sensitive information, including Social Security numbers, was stolen during a ransomware attack in July 2025. The incident, attributed to the Safepay ransomware group, compromised employment and job...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Stealthy 'PDFSIDER' Backdoor Uses DLL Side-Loading to Bypass EDR and AV
item.description:
Security researchers at Resecurity have uncovered a new stealthy backdoor, dubbed 'PDFSIDER,' that uses a DLL side-loading technique to evade EDR and antivirus solutions. The malware masquerades as a legitimate PDF application to load a malicious DLL, establishing an encrypted command-and-control ch...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Ransomware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: South Korean Giant Kyowon Group Hit by Ransomware, 9.6 Million Accounts at Risk
item.description:
The South Korean conglomerate Kyowon Group has confirmed it suffered a significant ransomware attack that disrupted operations and resulted in data exfiltration. The attack, detected on January 10, 2026, compromised approximately 600 of the company's 800 servers. South Korean authorities estimate th...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

item.title: 'DragonForce' Emerges as New Ransomware Cartel Built on LockBit and Conti DNA
item.description:
A new Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation named DragonForce has emerged, positioning itself as a "ransomware cartel." The group is reportedly building its operations on the leaked source code of the notorious LockBit 3.0 and Conti ransomware variants. Operating a RaaS platform called 'Ransombay...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware
